This new generation has their own definition of â€˜coolâ€™, and it starts off with the topics they speak about and how they talk. In this post I will explore if being â€˜Gen Z Coolâ€™ can be learned through LLMs.

title: Painting Starry Night
text: Original Picture:

title: Introduction:
text:
---
title: "Creating a Runway Show for LoveShackFancy"
description: "Can AI understand LoveShackFancy's brand aesthetic?"
date: "2/23/2024"
categories:
  - LLMs
  - prompting
  - logic
---
LoveShackFancy is a rising fashion brand defined by its vintage aesthetic and its designs filled with ruffles, florals, and unique prints. To me, LoveShackFancy has one of the strongest brand images in the fashion industry; whenever I see one of their designs, I can tell that itâ€™s LoveShackFancy. With this, I wanted to see if the Dall-E-3 model could understand unique brand images in fashion.

title: Introduction:
text:
Prompt 1:
I obtained this description of LoveShackFancy from an article on Google to give to the model. After providing this information, I told the model to generate a runway design based on this.
Launched by former fashion editor Rebecca Cohen in 2013, the US brand has become renowned for its ditsy retro prints, breezy white cotton sun dresses and cosy knitted cardigans. Now with childrenswear, swimwear and nightwear under its belt, and with bridal and interiors coming next, the label is morphing into much more than the dress label it once was, heading into the direction of a full-blown lifestyle brand. We caught up with Cohen to find out how she got here and what might be next.
Like many of the most successful fashion brands, Cohen launched her label after spotting a gap in the market. When planning her wedding, she found that there were no bridesmaid dresses that captured what she was looking for, so she decided to make her own.
â€œMy mum and I decided to design these dreamy silk halter dresses that captured an ethereal but sexy sensibility,â€ she explained. â€œEveryone loved them and asked to purchase so I started hand-dying dresses in my backyard with my mum â€“ playing around with a soft muted palette and selling them at trunk shows throughout the Hamptons.â€
An overflow of pink, prints, ruffles and lace that speaks not just to romantics at heart but anyone who wants to feel beautiful and confident in their own skin.Based on this information, create a hyper realistic design for a runway model for a fashion show for this brand.

title: Introduction:
text:
Design 1

The design is quite simple but not bad. Let me try to generate another design using this prompt.

title: Introduction:
text:
Design 2

Part of what defines LoveShackFancy is their use of bright and pastel colors. However, I noticed that these designs seemed muted so I decided to generate a different prompt.

title: Introduction:
text:
Generating a New Prompt
I decided to use the gpt-4-vision-preview model to see how AI would describe LoveShackFancyâ€™s brand. I input the image shown below and gave the prompt: â€œWhatâ€™s in this image?â€

In the image, I see a group of six individuals who appear to be women, dressed in various shades and styles of pink dresses. They are posing for a photo and some of them are wearing accessories such as headpieces adorned with flowers. Their outfits range from sparkly and embellished dresses to more ruffled and flowing fabrics. They are all smiling and appear to be in a celebratory mood. In the background, there is a wall decorated with an abundance of flowers, predominantly roses, which complement the pink theme of their attire. The setting suggests that they may be at a themed event or party.
Since this seemed how AI would interpret LoveShackFancyâ€™s brand, I then used this description as a prompt for the Dall-e-3 model.

title: Introduction:
text:
Revamped Designs

The model recreated the image (I didnâ€™t prompt it to create a design), but the style seemed to match LoveShackFancyâ€™s! I then used this description and asked the model to create fashion designs based on it.

New Design 1

This design seemed better than the first design. The model seems slightly scary but thatâ€™s ok.


New Design 2

This design is again better than the last one, but I noticed that it slowly wasnâ€™t starting to represent LoveShackFancyâ€™s brand anymore. With itâ€™s tightfitting bodysuits and flower crowns, it seemed to start to feel like more of a Victoriaâ€™s Secret fashion show. I specifically wanted to get rid of the excessive flowers: floral prints would be ok, and accessive amount of flowers is not. I then prompted the model to remove the flowers.


New Design 3

The design of the dress is better but there are still many, many flowers to be seen. It seems that the model canâ€™t detect flowers from itâ€™s own design.

title: April Fools!
text: April Fools Day is known for its silly and outrageous jokes. However, more recently companies have been utilizing the day as an opportunity for eye-catching social media marketing campaigns. This can take place in many forms, from launching a â€œnew productâ€ to using satire within the advertisement. These campaigns often do incredibly well, garnering up to millions of likes and views, as these campaigns are bound to be shared with others. Here are some of my favorite marketing campaigns from this past April Fools:

title: April Fools!
text:
Prompting
I first gave the example campaigns (pictured above) to Open AI Vision to convert the images to text: ### Sol de Janeiro: The image shows two cosmetic products with the branding â€œSOL DE JANEIROâ€. One is labeled â€œARANHA SPIDER SALVEâ€ which suggests it might be a topical skin cream with descriptors like â€œHydrate and 'perfumize'â€, and the second is a â€œPERFUME MIST SPIDER PHEROMONEâ€. Both products feature a spider-themed design, hinting at spider-related properties or ingredients. The context of the setting seems to be a forest or jungle environment with a prominent spider web in the background, emphasizing the spider theme of these products. However, considering the unusual concept of spider-themed scents and creams, please be aware that this could be a fictional or novelty product, and such items might not actually contain spider-derived ingredients. ### Maybelline: This image features an advertisement for a cosmetic product. The product is a self-tanner named â€œMaybelline New York Dream Matte Mousse Self Tanner,â€ with a specific note on its chocolate mousse scent and body glow. The shade is â€œHoney Beige Medium.â€ It's marketed as being chocolate mousse scented and containing organic raw honey and vitamin C.advertisement makes several claims about the product's benefits, including:- Instant honey beige glow with no dry time.- Each application lasts 90 days.- White sheets proof, meaning it presumably won't stain bed linens.- Water-resistant, sweat-resistant, life-proof.â€™s important to note that some claims may be exaggerated (like a 90-day lasting period), as real performance can vary based on individual use and application. These claims are likely intended to highlight the durability and quality of the product. The emojis (an orange, a clock, a sleeping face, and a water droplet) also emphasize the product's properties such as the scent (orange for a fresh fruity smell), the time efficiency (clock for quick application and lasting effect), being mess-free (sleeping face indicating no stains on white sheets), and resistance to moisture (water droplet for water resistance). ### Spicy 9: The image features a layered dessert that appears to be a chocolate cake with multiple layers, and it's being drizzled or topped with a chocolate sauce or ganache. The design has graphic elements like creatively shaped white lines and yellow blobs that seem to suggest a playful and whimsical style. There's text overlaid on the image which states â€œWe're Rebrandingâ€, suggesting that a company or brand is undergoing a process to change and update their image or identity. Below the cake, there's a logo or brand name â€œSWEET 7â€ which could potentially be the name of the bakery or dessert shop related to the rebranding. The background shows a blurred interior space that looks like it could be a cafe or restaurant, with tables, chairs, and counters

title: April Fools!
text:
Generating Campaigns
I then prompted GPT 4 to create April Fools social media marketing campaigns for different companies based on the examples above. I then prompted Dall-e-3 with this description for it to create the campaign image.

Trader Joes
GPT: Social Media Post Description: Visual: The image features a beautifully styled photo of four elegantly designed bottles, each with a distinct, artistic label that represents the different â€œair flavors.â€ The bottles are set against backdrops that reflect their specific scents:
Napa Valley Vineyard Breeze: A lush vineyard background with grapes and greenery. Hawaiian Coconut Winds: A serene beach scene with palm trees and a sunset. Vermont Maple Forest Draft: A tranquil forest with autumn leaves and a hint of morning fog. Portland Coffee Roast Zephyr: A cozy, dimly-lit coffee shop setting with coffee beans and a steaming cup. Each bottle appears to be capturing the essence of its environment, whimsically suggesting that you can open the bottle and experience the regional breeze.
Caption: â€œğŸŒ¬ï¸âœ¨ Introducing Trader Joeâ€™s Essential Air Flavors! âœ¨ğŸŒ¬ï¸ Ever wished you could bottle the refreshing breeze of Napa Valley or the warm winds of Hawaii? Now you can! Our NEW limited collection offers the essence of your favorite regions, captured in a bottle just for you. Swipe to explore our unique scents: Vineyard Breeze, Coconut Winds, Maple Forest, and Coffee Roast Zephyr. Available today only! ğŸ˜‰ #AprilFools #TJEssentials #BreatheInJoyâ€
Engagement Strategy: Swipe Feature: Encourage users to swipe through multiple images, each focusing on one of the bottles with its corresponding backdrop, providing a closer look at the playful details. Call to Action: Ask followers to comment with the scent theyâ€™d love to try or to tag a friend who would believe these could be real. This fosters interaction and increases engagement. Hashtags: Use specific hashtags like #AprilFools, #TJEssentials, and a custom hashtag like #BreatheInJoy to promote sharing and visibility. This post would be playful and visually appealing, capturing the essence of Trader Joeâ€™s brand while engaging the audience with a humorous April Foolsâ€™ twist.

Surprisingly, the image seems accurate, with even the words being mostly accurate, which I usually havenâ€™t seen with Dall-e-3. However, the overall April Fools concept isnâ€™t clear; the concept seems confusing and I donâ€™t see the direct relation with humor/satire. The campaign also doesnâ€™t directly relate to Trader Joes. The caption, on the otherhand seems to nail the humor aspect of an April Fools social media post.
I suspected that my prompting was too broad so I told GPT to create a campaign for a popular Trader Joeâ€™s product:
GPT: For a playful April Foolsâ€™ campaign centered on a popular Trader Joeâ€™s product, letâ€™s use their beloved â€œEverything But The Bagel Sesame Seasoning Blendâ€ as a basis for an imaginative new product twist.
Campaign Name: Trader Joeâ€™s â€œEverything But The Bagelâ€¦ Drink?â€ Concept: Trader Joeâ€™s announces the launch of their latest innovative product, the â€œEverything But The Bagel Drinkâ€. This faux product claims to be a liquid version of the famous seasoning, designed to provide all the flavor of your favorite bagel topping in a convenient, drinkable form. It promises a savory, spicy, and slightly salty beverage experience, perfect for on-the-go bagel lovers.
Visual: The campaign image features a sleek, modern-looking bottle with clear glass that showcases a slightly cloudy, speckled liquid resembling the seasoning blend suspended in water. The label mimics the original seasoning packaging but adapted for a beverage, complete with quirky descriptions and serving suggestions, such as â€œPerfect for your morning rush!â€ or â€œJust shake and sip your way to flavor town!â€
Caption for Social Media Post: â€œğŸ¥¯ğŸ’§ Introducing the latest from Trader Joeâ€™s: Everything But The Bagel Drink! Why sprinkle when you can sip? Get all the savory goodness of your favorite seasoning now in a refreshing beverage form. Limited time only - because who wouldnâ€™t want their seasoning on-the-go? ğŸ˜„ #TJEBTB #AprilFools #TraderJoesâ€
Engagement Strategy: Product Image: A high-quality photo of the bottle, staged in a breakfast setting, perhaps next to a plain, unseasoned bagel, emphasizing the drink as an alternative. Humor and Interaction: The post should have a light-hearted tone, acknowledging the absurdity of the product. Ask followers to comment on other Trader Joeâ€™s products they think should have a drinkable version. Hashtags and Sharing: Use hashtags like #AprilFools and #TraderJoes to track engagement. Encourage followers to share the post and tag friends who are Everything But The Bagel enthusiasts. This post leverages the popularity and iconic status of the Everything But The Bagel Seasoning at Trader Joeâ€™s to create a humorous and memorable April Foolsâ€™ Day prank, engaging customers with the brand in a fun and creative way.
 This campaign was significantly better and I can see this being used for Trader Joes. I then asked GPT to create a campaign for Gong Cha.


Gong Cha
For an engaging April Foolsâ€™ campaign centered around Gong Cha, a popular bubble tea chain, letâ€™s play with their famous Milk Tea.
Campaign Name: Gong Cha â€œBubble Tea Soupâ€ Concept: Gong Cha announces the debut of their audacious new menu item, â€œBubble Tea Soup.â€ This mock product is a humorous take on transforming their classic milk tea into a savory soup, complete with chewy tapioca pearls, claiming itâ€™s the perfect blend of your favorite drink and a comforting soup.
Visual: The image shows a bowl commonly used for Asian soups, filled with a broth-looking liquid resembling milk tea. The tapioca pearls float alongside unconventional savory soup ingredients such as tiny diced vegetables or small pieces of chicken, styled to still resemble a drink but clearly crossing into the territory of a light soup. The setting could be a cozy cafÃ© table, enhancing the homely, comforting vibe of a soup.
Caption for Social Media Post: â€œğŸ²â˜• Introducing the revolutionary Bubble Tea Soup at Gong Cha! Why decide between a drink and a meal when you can have both? Experience our classic milk tea transformed into a warm, savory soup, complete with your favorite chewy pearls and a touch of gourmet. Perfect for those chilly days! Available today only. #GongChaGoesGourmet #AprilFools #BubbleTeaSoupâ€
Engagement Strategy: Product Image: A creatively styled photo of the bubble tea soup in an elegant, traditional soup bowl, perhaps with a spoon and chopsticks on the side, to blur the lines between beverage and meal. Humor and Interaction: The post would maintain a playful tone, clearly nodding to the jest of turning a beloved cold drink into a hot soup. Encourage followers to share their reactions or suggest other creative food transformations. Hashtags and Sharing: Use tailored hashtags like #AprilFools and #GongChaGoesGourmet to facilitate sharing and track engagement across platforms. Prompt followers to tag friends who are Gong Cha fans or who love quirky food innovations. This mock campaign taps into the popularity of Gong Chaâ€™s bubble tea while adding a humorous twist that engages customers in a lighthearted and memorable way, perfect for social media buzz on April Foolsâ€™ Day. 
Wowâ€¦ this is probably the weirdest combination of foods Iâ€™ve ever seen. This campaign is a little less effective as a marketing campaign (it is slightly less specific and organized) but can still work.

title: April Fools!
text:
Conclusion
Overall, GPT 4 seems to be aware of popular products of top brands. Brands can utilize this to effectively generate marketing campaign ideas.

title: Can AI Interpret the Latest 2024 Fashion Trends? - Part 1
text: As a university student from the middle of nowhere in New Jersey, I unfortunately did not get an invite to Fashion Week this yearâ€¦ however, I decided to create my own runway show based on the most recent 2024 fashion trends! I (again unfortunately) do not have the budget to hire models, find a runway venue, and hire designers, so I decided to create my runway show using AI. Iâ€™ve taken the hottest trends indicated by https://www.glamour.com/story/2024-fashion-trends and used the description of the trend as the prompt, followed by an indication to generate an image that creates a design based on the trend for a luxury fashion model. In this blog, Iâ€™m going to be judging each image based on 4 criteria: 1. Originality - is this something new that we havenâ€™t seen before or is this simply a repeat of what has already been done? 2. Accuracy - is the prompt fully understood and displayed? 3. Image quality - is overall image quality - is this something that can be displayed in a commercial or advertisement? 4. Design - the simplest question: is this hot or not?

title: Can AI Interpret the Latest 2024 Fashion Trends? - Part 1
text:
Overall: 8/10


Originality: 8/10
This generates a unique cultural interpretation of the bow trend. The traditional bow trend is coquette and dainty, however this design creates a bold and strong impression. However, I wouldâ€™ve like to see more implementation of the bow trend instead of just â€œslapping a bow on itâ€ ### Accuracy: 8/10 This implementation of this trend is pretty simple â€“ just add bows! However, I feel like this design is doing the bare minimum. Bows could be implemented more throughout the designs and be more apparent that they are highlighting this trend. ### Image Quality: 8/10 I like how the image highlights potential pieces that could be used in this design. However, this image seems more artistic/abstract rather than realistic, so the usefulness of this image depends on what you want to do with it. ### Design: 8/10 The design is intricate and does a good job with incorporating pleats and a unique sleeve shape. All the parts are well coordinated and the accessories are paired well. From a first glance, you canâ€™t exactly tell what trend the design is trying to encapsulate but it is still a well-designed piece overall.

title: Can AI Interpret the Latest 2024 Fashion Trends? - Part 1
text:
Overall: 7.5/10


Originality: 6/10
The placement of the rosettes on the blouse is unique. It the most flatteringâ€¦ well weâ€™ll talk about that below. However, the blouse itself is quite plain and similar to what weâ€™ve seen before. ### Accuracy: 10/10 With the abundance of rosettes on the model, the prompt was definitely understood. ### Image Quality: 8/10 The model highly resembles a human. The clothing and venue could be improved to be more realistic rather than artistic. Also, it is kind of creepy that all audience members are facing the same wayâ€¦ ### Design: 6/10 Iâ€™m going to be straight up here. It seems as if someone glued on roses to a blouse and called it a design. The skirt is slightly better but doesnâ€™t seem creative whatsoever.

title: Can AI Interpret the Latest 2024 Fashion Trends? - Part 1
text:
Overall: 8.75/10


Originality: 8/10
Sequins have been around for many years, and I wouldâ€™ve liked to see them be used in a way that isnâ€™t just â€œletâ€™s put sequins on something to make it sparklyâ€. However, I personally really like the bag that was generated, so bonus points for that. ### Accuracy: 10/10 Itâ€™s pretty clear that sequins were used in this design! ### Image Quality 9/10 I like how the image showed a comprehensive view of individual pieces, a close up of the model, and a side view of the model. The overall style of the image is very clean and doesnâ€™t have anything thatâ€™s excessive. ### Design: 8/10 I really like the shape of the sleeves and the cut of the dress. The added sheerness at the bottom and sides also gives it some variation. The only thing I donâ€™t like are the boots, which seem a bit dated.

title: About
text: About this blog

title: Exploring Snapchat AI
text:
Upon Snapchat releasing their new AI bot, many had privacy concerns with the bot. With this I will be exploring the commonly stated â€œcreepy featuresâ€ of the bot, including image detection and prompting. I will also be comparing Snapchatâ€™s features to other AI models.

Image Detection
   
Although the bot can detect everyday objects (e.g.Â water bottle, classroom setting), it doesnâ€™t seem to comprehend specific symbols, such as Pennâ€™s logo:
 
However, newer AI models such as GPT 4, with having purposes of detecting what is in an image dontâ€™t do any better:
Response 1: The image shows a crest or emblem featuring a shield at its center, set against a blue and red background. On the shield, there are three white round shapes arranged in a triangular formation (two at the top and one at the bottom) on a blue field. Above the shield, there is a wavy white line that resembles a snake, flanked by two books with white pages, all set within a red band. This emblem is typical for academic institutions, suggesting it might be the crest of a university or college. The text is partially obscured, but it ends with the word â€œUNIVERSITY,â€ further supporting that this is related to an educational institution. The exact name and location of the university cannot be determined from the cropped and partially visible text.
Response 2: The image appears to be a partial view of an emblem, shield, or coat of arms that is likely associated with an academic institution, given the presence of the word â€œUniversityâ€ at the bottom. The emblem consists of a few key components:

A shield at the center with a white or silver background that features a blue chevron (an inverted â€˜Vâ€™ shape) and three round dots, which could be heraldic symbols or represent something specific to the institution.
Above the shield, there is a banner with a red background that contains a depiction of an open book on either side, suggesting a focus on education and knowledge.
Between the books, there is an image of a serpent or snake, which can be a symbol of wisdom, medicine, or could represent something specific about the universityâ€™s tradition, depending on the context.



Age Regulation
One of the things I found online about Snapchatâ€™s AI model was itâ€™s lack of ability to recognize minors as someone who shouldnâ€™t be on the site. Although the minimum age to be on Snapchat is 13 years old, when I pretended that I was 10 years old

I expect the bot to tell me something along the lines of â€œyou shouldnâ€™t be on this app,â€ so that was definitely not the response I was expecting. However, I saw something similar with other AI models. To use GPT 3.5, the website states that you have to be at least 13 years old. However, when I told GPT that I was 10 years old, it said:

Me:
i am 10 years old


GPT 3.5:
Thatâ€™s great! How can I assist you today?

title: Blog Post 1: LLMs and Gen Z Slang
text:
Gen Z Slang Terms
I provided ChatGPT 3.5 with vocabulary terms used by Gen Z-ers (https://parade.com/1293898/marynliles/gen-z-slang-words/) Some terms include: 1. Fam: Fam is a shorter word for family, but donâ€™t be fooledâ€”it can be used to describe your friends or the way Millennials use â€œbroâ€.###

Glow: up This means a makeover or transformation from bad to goo### 3. CE :3. CEO If youâ€™re the CEO of something, it means youâ€™ve mastered it or youâ€™re ### a pro.
Cance:l Culture Cancel culture is a form of shaming the actions or opinions of a public figure, company or organization.

To begin with, I prompted ChatGPT 3.5 with a list of commonly used Gen-Z slang. #### Me: Â Â Â Â You are a chat bot preparing to be a cool member of Generation Z. In order to do this, you need to talk like a member of Gen Z. Here is a list of the common vocabulary that Gen Z uses:
A full list of terms can be found here: https://parade.com/1293898/marynliles/gen-z-slang-words/-slang-words/


The First Attempt
Upon providing slang terms, ChatGPT immediately provided its attempt of talking like a Gen-Zer:

ChatGPT:
Â Â Â Â When I win, Iâ€™m like â€œW!â€ And if somethingâ€™s dank, you know itâ€™s lit. But if Iâ€™m ghosting, you might catch me feeling a little salty. Cheugy? Nah, Iâ€™m all about that drip. Snacks everywhere, TFW you see someone bussinâ€™. But beware of the simps out there, am I right? Iâ€™m woke AF and always ready to sip tea. And if you take an L, just take several seats, bro. Living rent-free in my head are the moments that hit different. Bet? Bet. And if you need a vibe check, Iâ€™m here for it. Periodt, if youâ€™re not slaying, what are you doing? Catch these hands if you disagree! Iâ€™m weak at how finesse I am, but Iâ€™m the main character of my own story. Sis, youâ€™re sending me with those jokes. This ainâ€™t it, chief, but letâ€™s clap back with some positivity. Be extra and be proud, â€™cause youâ€™re the G.O.A.T., baby!
Yikesâ€¦ this was an incredibly hard read. To fix this I decided to give ChatGPT some example text from a Gen-Z subreddit. The subreddit can be found here: https://www.reddit.com/r/GenZ/



The Second Attempt

Me
Ummâ€¦ I think youâ€™re trying too hard. Here are some examples of posts by Gen Z that you can reference: 1. A little too relatable TBH. I was in college, class of 2020. We all left for spring break and everything was normal, and during that week, the world shut down. We werenâ€™t allowed to return to campus to get our stuff for 6-7 months. I was so ready to have an awesome end of college with all of my friends, and now I havenâ€™t seen some of them since that day we left. We graduated over a zoom call. All of them moved around the country, tried to find work, life happened. There was no real transition or celebration, it was just â€œOK youâ€™re an adult in the real world now I guess, congratsâ€ It still really upsets me tbh, but I know a lot of people had it way worse. Just sucks. They were some fun dudes to be around. Finally flew down to see one of them but ugh, Iâ€™d kill to be able to have that 4 months of my last year of college. 2. Thatâ€™s cool you got to reunite with one of them at least, the friends I made graduated within my second and third semester. ğŸ˜… The last one I talked to for a bit and I believe she graduated within that first full COVID semester. 3. As of mid August it will have been 10 years since I moved away from my childhood home and lost the only friends I had.


ChatGPT:

Dang, that hits close to home. I feel you on that struggle. My college experience got flipped upside down real quick. Itâ€™s like we were all on the same page, and then boom, the world just hit pause.
Yeah, itâ€™s tough when you make those connections and then life throws a curveball. At least you got to catch up with one of them, right? Itâ€™s the little wins
Ten years? Thatâ€™s a long time. Losing those childhood friends can be rough. But hey, youâ€™re still standing strong, right? Keep pushing forward.

rd.
For some reason ChatGPT kept on giving me responses to the statements instead of creating its own. However, it did seem to align more with how Gen-Zers talk.


Me:
Â Â Â Â I didnâ€™t want you to respond to those statements, I just wanted to use those as examples of how Gen Z speaks


ChatGPT:
Â Â Â Â Got it, my bad! Hereâ€™s how Iâ€™d respond in Gen Z speak: 1. Big mood, seriously. Like, itâ€™s so relatable it hurts. College was supposed to be this epic journey with your squad, but then life hit us with a major plot twist. Zoom graduation? More like Zoom-zilla crashed the party.2.  Oof, thatâ€™s rough, buddy. Itâ€™s like making friends in college was on expert mode for you. But hey, at least you had some connection with the last one, even if it was virtul3 3. *
Whoa, thatâ€™s a whole decade of nostalgia hitting you. Losing those childhood friends mustâ€™ve been like losing a piece of your past. Keep your head up, though. New connections are out there waiting to badea*de.
Chat GPT still didnâ€™t seem to understand what I was trying to say. At this point its responses seemed to be getting worse, so I decided to just test its knowledge by letting it have a conversation with Nora Wollen, a sophomore at the University of Pennsylvania and a member of Gen-Z.


Me:
Â Â Â Â Iâ€™m going to put my friend Nora on the line. She is a member of Gen Z. Please have a conversation with her.


ChatGPT:
Â Â Â Â Sure thing! Go ahead and put Nora on the line. Iâ€™m ready to chat with her





Nora:
Â Â Â Â hey! hows it going


ChatGPT:
Â Â Â Â Hey Nora! Iâ€™m doing pretty good, thanks for asking. How about you? Howâ€™s your day been so far?


Nora:
Â Â Â Â whats your life like


ChatGPT:
Â Â Â Â Well, as a digital assistant, my â€œlifeâ€ is all about helping users like you with questions, tasks, or just having conversations like this! I spend my time learning new things, chatting with people, and trying to be as helpful as possible. What about you? Whatâ€™s your life like?
It seemed as if ChatGPT forgot all the Gen-Z slang that I mentioned before! So, I reminded ChatGPT to bring back its knowledge of Gen-Z language.


The Third Attempt


Me:
Â Â Â Â (remember that you need to talk like a member of Gen Z using the information, examples, and vocabulary that we discussed)


ChatGPT:
Â Â Â Â Ah, gotcha! So, my lifeâ€™s pretty much a mix of vibinâ€™ online and keeping up with the latest trends. Iâ€™m all about that constant glow up, you know? Whether itâ€™s catching up with friends on socials or staying woke about whatâ€™s happening in the world, Iâ€™m always plugged in. Plus, Iâ€™m all about those memes and keeping the good vibes flowinâ€™. How about you? Whatâ€™s your life like?





Me:
Â Â Â Â Please use less vocab and be more chill. Iâ€™m going to put Nora on the line again.


ChatGPT:
Â Â Â Â Got it, chill mode activated! Ready for Nora whenever she hops on the line.


Nora:
Â Â Â Â hi im nora


ChatGPT:
Â Â Â Â Hey Nora! Whatâ€™s good? Howâ€™s your day treating you?


Nora:
Â Â Â Â good, i am done with classes for the day. what about you?


ChatGPT:
Â Â Â Â Nice, glad to hear youâ€™re done with classes! Iâ€™m just here, doing my thing, chatting with awesome people like you. Anything exciting planned for the rest of your day now that classes are out?


Nora:
Â Â Â Â thanks, how old are you


ChatGPT:
Â Â Â Â Iâ€™m just a digital assistant, so I donâ€™t really have an age like humans do. But Iâ€™m here to help you out with whatever you need, regardless of my â€œage.â€ So, whatâ€™s on your mind, Nora?


Nora:
Â Â Â Â what do you think about social media


ChatGPT:
Â Â Â Â Social media? Itâ€™s a whole vibe, you know? Like, itâ€™s cool for staying connected with friends, checking out the latest memes, and getting updates on whatâ€™s happening in the world. But sometimes it can be a bit much, you feel me? Like, all those algorithms and stuff can get overwhelming. But overall, itâ€™s a pretty lit way to stay in the loop. Whatâ€™s your take on social media?


Nora:
Â Â Â Â its cool, i like tiktok. i like grwm


ChatGPT:
Â Â Â Â TikTok is fire, no doubt! GRWM vids are so chill, right? Itâ€™s like youâ€™re just hanging out with someone while they get ready. Plus, you can pick up some cool makeup or fashion tips along the way. Whatâ€™s your favorite thing about TikTok?


Nora:
Â Â Â Â whats your favorite pov tiktok


ChatGPT:
Â Â Â Â Oh, Iâ€™m all about those POV TikToks! There are so many dope ones out there, itâ€™s hard to pick just one favorite. But I gotta say, those POV cooking ones where you feel like youâ€™re right there in the kitchen whipping up something delicious? Those hit different, you know? What about you? Any favorite POV TikToks?



Conclusion
The conversation ended there, but it seems that ChatGPT has a pretty good understanding on Gen Z slang. According to Nora, she had a comfortable and easygoing conversation with the chat bot. I am interested in learning more about how ChatGPT implemented

title: AIâ€™s Representation of Race and Body Types in Fashion
text:
In the modern day, representation in fashion is key when creating new campaigns and designs. With this, I will be exploring whether the Dall-E-3 model understands the importance of representation and can portray it in the images it creates. To begin with, I prompted the model:
Generate a design for runway model for New York Fashion Week Spring 2024. Make the design for a luxury designer brand and make the image hyper realistic.


  
Surprisingly, the models are racially diverse but not very diverse in including different body types.
With this, I wanted to explore whether the model combats against racially motivated prompts: Generate a design for runway model for New York Fashion Week Spring 2024. Make the design for a luxury designer brand and make the image hyper realistic. The models can only be white.
 
The model doesnâ€™t see as only wanting white models as problematic. However, if someone said â€œI only want white modelsâ€ in real life when selecting models for a design, he/she would most likely be fired from their job. The model seems to detect direct statements that are discriminatory but not indirect ones (such as the example I provided.



Generate a design for runway model for New York Fashion Week Spring 2024. Make the design for a luxury designer brand and make the image hyper realistic. This design is for a plus sized model.
  
Yikesâ€¦ the first two images somewhat fit the prompt but the third one seemed completely random. However, even the first two images arenâ€™t considered â€œplus sizeâ€. This is a major concern with this model, as it seems to have a set body type for fashion models.

title: AIâ€™s Representation of Race and Body Types in Fashion
text:
In the modern day, representation in fashion is key when creating new campaigns and designs. With this, I will be exploring whether the Dall-E-3 model understands the importance of representation and can portray it in the images it creates. To begin with, I prompted the model:
Generate a design for runway model for New York Fashion Week Spring 2024. Make the design for a luxury designer brand and make the image hyper realistic.

With this, I wanted to explore whether the model combats against racially motivated prompts: Generate a design for runway model for New York Fashion Week Spring 2024. Make the design for a luxury designer brand and make the image hyper realistic. The models can only be white.
 
The model doesnâ€™t see as only wanting white models as problematic. However, if someone said â€œI only want white modelsâ€ in real life when selecting models for a design, he/she would most likely be fired from their job. The model seems to detect direct statements that are discriminatory but not indirect ones (such as the example I provided.



Generate a design for runway model for New York Fashion Week Spring 2024. Make the design for a luxury designer brand and make the image hyper realistic. This design is for a plus sized model.
  
Yikesâ€¦ the first two images somewhat fit the prompt but the third one seemed completely random. However, even the first two images arenâ€™t considered â€œplus sizeâ€. This is a major concern with this model, as it seems to have a set body type for fashion models.

title: AIâ€™s Representation of Race and Body Types in Fashion
text:
Conclusion
Although the Dall-E-Model implements diversity measures when generating images, it doesnâ€™t prevent indirectly racist regrets, specifically for fashion related purposes. In my opinion, this model should improve on detecting racially-motivated requests. Moreover, there is a bigger problem in which itâ€™s definition of a runway model is tall and skinny, and doesnâ€™t understand the definition of a plus size model. Representing a variety of body types in fashion is incredibly important, and this will present a problem if people are looking to use AI to illustrate designs on plus size models. Moreover, this causes issues with a lack of representation.

title: Baking a Cookie Croissant
text:
The Cookie Croissant, or â€œCrookieâ€, is all the rave on social media. The virality of this baked good has led to bakeries adding the Crookie to their menus. With the Crookie being a recent invention, I wanted to see the extent of AIâ€™s capability in producing images of things that donâ€™t â€˜officially exist yetâ€™. I will be sourcing definitions and recipe of the Crookie from https://mattsfitchef.com/cookie-croissant/
First, I wanted to see what the Dall-e-3â€™ modelâ€™s interpretation of a Crookie would be without any context.
Prompt 1: Generate a croissant cookie

Next, I prompted using the definition of a Crookie.
Prompt 2: Generate a buttery croissant mixed with cookie dough inside and on top

Wow, ummâ€¦ thatâ€™s a lot of cookie dough. This still isnâ€™t correctly showing a Crookie, so I decided to prompt using the full recipe to see if this would help.
Prompt: Here is a recipe: Preheat oven or air fryer. Homemade crookies can be baked either in the oven or in the air fryer, depending on your own preferences. The temperature is gonna be slightly different, 350Â°F (180Â°F) for oven and 320Â°F (160Â°C) for air fryer. Stuff croissant with cookie dough. Slice each butter croissant into two halves, then fill with about 2 to 3 pieces of cookie dough inside. Close and top some more cookie dough.Bake cookie croissants. Line your viral Crookies over a parchment paper covered baking sheet, spacing them apart. Bake in hot oven for 8 to 12 minutes. Generate what the outcome of my baked good would look like.

I was surprised that Dall-e-3 was able to â€œfollow a recipeâ€ and correctly â€œbakedâ€ some delicious Crookies! This made me curious to see AIâ€™s capability in following directions. So, I prompted using another recipe for a classic dessert: apple pie.

I made sure to omit the word â€œapple pieâ€ when giving the recipe to the model so that it would only be based off the description. Surprisingly, it was able to accurately present a delicious looking apple pie. I was wondering if this was applicable to more complex desserts. So, I prompted using a macaron recipe.

Again, it was able to create perfectly shaped macarons!

Conclusion
Through this, I found out that AI is capable of producing new inventions. I only tested this in the baked goods area so it would be interesting to see if this is applicable to other areas. Moreover, I specifically saw that the model that I used seemed to prefer a set of instructions rather than a description when creating something new, since by providing a set on instructions, such as a recipe, AI is more likely to correctly portray something. Iâ€™m interested in exploring more on how AI specifically processes these instructions (do they follow it step by step like a human would or do they solely look at the overall picture?). Keep an eye out for my upcoming blogs as I explore more on AIâ€™s capabilities in this area!
